posts.name:
Neeraj Kumar
Neeraj Kumar
posts.content:
Complaint Against Fraudulent Service Record at Ganpati Automobiles Hero MotoCorp 

I recently received a message stating that my bike was serviced at Ganpati Automobiles Hero MotoCorp in Deoria However, this is completely false as my bike is currently in Delhi and has not been moved from here.

This raises serious concerns about fraudulent practices at this service center. It appears that someone may be falsely logging services under my bike's details, potentially using my bike’s records for unauthorized activities or profits.

I urgeto:

1. Investigate this fraudulent entry.


2. Hold Ganpati Automobiles accountable for such malpractice.


3. Ensure transparency and prevent misuse of customer details in the future.



Such behavior is unacceptable and erodes the trust customers place in Hero MotoCorp. I expect immediate action and a detailed explanation regarding this issue.

comments.commentText: Hi Neeraj, this is not the experience we would like you to have with us. Kindly share your contact details, vehicle registration number with us using this link -so that our team will look into this right away.

posts.name:
The Corporate Bhakt ™️
The Corporate Bhakt ™️
posts.content:
Only performers survive!

In the latest round of layoffs, 1% of Microsoft’s global workforce is being terminated.

Microsoft currently employs approximately 2.28 lakh individuals worldwide, as estimated in June 2024.

via

comments.commentText:
There is no alternative for non- performance. It's non negotiable, and should be. Or else , how to justify if to have shutdown the shop. 

Business thrives on boldness, aggression, and some time required tough decisions.

However, lately people got infected with concept like - we are family, work life balance is must and much more.

For those things you have other 10 to 16 hrs.

Offices are meant for work. A work that need to have clear goals, commitment, high accountability., where as an individual we signup while taking the offer.

comments.commentText:
My dad have a long term company called 12trust

Personal stuff aside, i really liked the branding

So i made Trust a Family word...

Now, Tegos, means Family in Gaulish Celtic...

Scotland

Erling, Heir of Clanchief..

So i made the company Trust Tegos..

At-least the website...
Great post! Your commitment to quality and supplier selection is so impressive, I'm almost convinced you could find me a unicorn supplier. Keep up the good work!

posts.name:
Minakshi G.
Minakshi G.
posts.content:
A man living peacefully with a family of cheetahs—sounds unreal, doesn’t it? 

But It’s amazing how wild animals and humans can coexist when there’s
,
,
, and
.

Interestingly, these same
are the foundation of a
and
.




The cheetahs trust the man because he respects their boundaries and understands their needs. Similarly, in the workplace, trust is built when leaders and colleagues honor commitments, listen actively, and create a safe environment for everyone to thrive.


Ask yourself: Are you fostering a space where your team feels secure and valued?




The man’s kind actions make the cheetahs feel safe. In the workplace, simple acts of kindness—like appreciating someone’s efforts or lending a hand—can create a positive and supportive environment.

Remember: A kind gesture often leads to stronger, more productive relationships.



The man understands the cheetahs’ needs and works with them. At work, understanding your colleagues’ perspectives can help resolve conflicts and build stronger relationships.

Tip: Start by listening without judgment during team discussions or conflicts.



The bond between the man and the cheetahs thrives because of respect. In the office, respecting everyone’s role and contributions leads to better teamwork and a happier workplace.

Insight: Respect isn’t just about hierarchy, it’s about valuing everyone’s contributions equally.



This video of a man living with cheetahs is a testament to what’s possible when we prioritize trust, empathy, kindness, and respect. Whether in nature or the workplace, these values are timeless and universal.

Let’s draw inspiration from this extraordinary bond and strive to create a corporate culture where even the wildest of ideas, personalities, and differences can coexist beautifully.

How are you fostering trust and empathy in your workplace? Share your thoughts!

posts.content: In yet another suspected cardiac arrest case among toddlers, an eight-year-old girl studying in Class 3 died in her school in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Friday (10.1.25).
